content.raw: If I'm reading correctly, discussion in pull request #248 included the suggestion by @tkoolen that the BDI controller uses the ability to adjust CFM damping parameter very high (above suggested limits) as a work around to the noise introduced when running physics with time step and iteration parameters adjusted to run in real time. Can you confirm this? If so, it seems that we'd want to be able to do the same thing, and furthermore to know exactly what value is used by the BDI controller.
content.html: If I'm reading correctly, discussion in pull request #248 included the suggestion by @tkoolen that the BDI controller uses the ability to adjust CFM damping parameter very high (above suggested limits) as a work around to the noise introduced when running physics with time step and iteration parameters adjusted to run in real time. Can you confirm this? If so, it seems that we'd want to be able to do the same thing, and furthermore to know exactly what value is used by the BDI controller.
